characters: EXT. HOTEL REAR DELIVERY AREA. DAY
THE GENOCIDE ENDED IN LATE JUNE 1994, WHEN THE TUTSI REBE
EXT. HOTEL REAR CAR PARK. NIGHT
INT. SABENA PRESIDENT'S OFFICE. BRUSSELS. DAY
TWO MILLION HUTUS FLED INTO THE NEIGHBORING CONGO IN THE
PHOTO TURNS TO PHOTO OF REAL PAUL AND HIS FAMILY.
THEY LEFT BEHIND ALMOST ONE MILLION CORPSES.
INT. HOTEL DIPLOMAT MANAGER'S OFFICE. DAY
INT. BANQUET ROOM/HOTEL MILLE COLLINES. DAY
INT. SABENA PRESIDENT'S OFFICE. BRUSSELS. NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A burning white sun high in a clear blue sky,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rundown (sixties) airport, peeling in the heat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mad traffic jam of cars, vans, motorbikes all stopped a where a RWANDAN POLICEMAN blows his whistle, waves some a others as bored Rwandan soldiers look on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A white van pulls out of traffic, a balls-out c jumping. HORNS, OBSCENITIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HAND: Extends from the passenger side of the van, Rwand pressed neatly between thumb and palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van stops next to the policeman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Rusesabagina, good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the passenger seat PAUL RUSESABAGINA, late 30's, flash is dressed in a sharp blue suit (always dressed in a neat it is a matter of pride).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quick shake of hands. Money passes from one to the othe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van parked by the runway tarmac. African music plays Paul drums his fingers, checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOZO, porter/driver, early thirties, sits nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An airport baggage handler approaches the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, the flight is delayed one more hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (to Zozo)                                               He can get the beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly worried) Rutaganda's place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beg your pardon sir, you are Hutu. You are safe there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are with me, Zozo, don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zozo throws the van into gear and speeds off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white van, marked "THE HOTEL MILLE COLLINES," whips i Kigali's packed streets and open-air markets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zozo works THE HORN, weaves in and out of traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it like to fly on a plane, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It depends where you sit Zozo. In coach it is like the bus to Giterama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is why they call it coach?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. But in business class there are fine wines, linens, Belgian chocolates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) You have taken business class?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Zozo slows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul looks up, SEES: a gathering on the side of the road crowd of men dressed in exotically, yet identically color They're members of the INTERAHAMWE - the Hutu Militia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Interahamwe - the Hutu Militia will de distinguished by colored shirts) They chant, drink beer, dance onto the ro obstructing cars, threatening the occupants. Several of t rhythmic dance - the INTERAHAMWE war dance to thumping dr from a boombox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zozo, scared, looks for a side road, studies the traffic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is nowhere to turn, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the van approaches,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van pulls up beside the Militia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys, do you know the way to Mr. Rutagunda's warehouse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some Militia approach. They are suddenly friendly, helpfu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is one more mile on this road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul reaches into his pocket, takes out some Rwandan doll

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is thirsty work, let me treat you to some beers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the van pulls away Zozo looks to Paul, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At his desk in front of a fan. GEORGE RUTAGUNDA, late 30' chains, Rolex watch, (like an African Mafia boss) but the Interahamwe shirt. He squeezes an orange rind into a cup

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, through his office window, the white van is b with cases of beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George holds out his massive shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will join us at the rally today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul sits opposite, sipping coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will try my best George but these days I have no time for rallies or politics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Politics is power, Paul. And money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul studies his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time is money, George. We need extra beer today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Business is good at the hotel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am always glad to see you Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George leads Paul out into the warehouse. As a forklift lifts A WOODEN CRATE, George angers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell man, that is not beer, put it back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, sir, the Carlsberg is behind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the Carlsberg, give him Grolsch. (to Paul)                                                 I won't charge extra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver of the forklift, anxiously, spins the machine crate but it slides off and CRASHES onto the floor: MACHE of them, spill out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward moment then George picks one of the crude blad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bargain buy, from China. Ten cents each, I'll get a dollar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Zozo terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Sabena airliner lands. Passengers disembark via a roll-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's van pulls up by the luggage belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large polystyrene box comes down the conveyor belt. It Kigali destination stickers all over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Zozo picks it up, water sloshes from the lid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ice has melted!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zozo goes to open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul slips money to two customs officials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van speeds through traffic. More traffic jams, Zozo e sidewalk. Then at an intersection they see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE INTERAHAMWE PARADE - a mass of young men and women, m same colorful uniform. Line after line, waves all perform INTERAHAMWE war dance, in wild hypnotic sync, many wave s wooden imitation guns. A large banner reads, "Hutu Power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flatbed truck, speakers blare drumbeat music. On it GEO dances the DANCE and waves a machete to the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zozo sinks down behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit up, smile, Zozo, don't attract attention to yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss, some of those men are my neighbors, they know I'm Tutsi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parade passes. As they wait Paul takes out the wad of gave him, peels off a few dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, Zozo, for your trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zozo takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van turns off the street into The Milles Collines Hot and HONKS twice as it pulls down a short drive lined with An ARMED GUARD rushes from his booth and lifts the gate. timed. The van doesn't even have to slow as it passes. A guard house reads "WELCOME TO THE HOTEL MILLE COLLINES".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lush tropical gardens, peacocks wander the well-manicured exotic African paradise. The van heads to a magnificent c building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull up at the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A valet opens the front door of the hotel and looks shock unheard of for a service van to stop out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgent, to the valet) Help Zozo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul leads Zozo and the valet into a magnificent lobby, a blend of Africa and Europe. Guests stare as water sloshes from the crate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GREGOIRE, early thirties the receptionist behind the desk of disapproval. Paul, imperial, snaps his finger toward h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: spilled water) Gregoire. Take care of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregoire engages a guest in chit-chat, ignores Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregoire!   See to this right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator door opens and reveals BIK the Belgian hotel 40's, reading some reports. He looks up, sees Paul and Zo the box as they step in. Bik looks puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an emergency, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Bik sees the wet floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregoire will deal with it, excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors shut. Bik's left standing in disbelief

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crate is hefted onto a counter. The top pried off. A cooks gathers around Paul and Zozo as they peer in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any of them make it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into the sink!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hoist up one end of the crate and LOBSTERS spill out it into the sink, but some miss and slide across the coun onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cooks sort the living from the dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve are dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cooks smells a dead lobster, shakes his head no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dump the bad meat, save the shells, fill them will ah, a stuffing, something local.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cassava, and Tipali.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Call it 'fresh Scottish Lobster in a cassava and Tipali crush'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul fixes his tie, very pleased, another crisis solved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul inspects the tables' fresh flowers, sparkling crysta looks to the bar - Grolsch on ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of African drums fills the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul emerges, as a troupe of African male dancers in cere - Leopard skin dress, ostrich feather head dress, spears perform a greeting dance for a the American Ambassador an European dignitaries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The male dancers are joined by a troupe of young female d similar ceremonial dress. The ceremony comes to a foot st The guests break into LOUD APPLAUSE. Paul flings open dou reception room and the crowd moves in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Ambassador, please come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A UN Colonel, OLIVER, middle aged, Canadian,follows the U The Colonel wear the blue berets and armbands of UN Peace UN troops will be distinguished by their bright blue bere helmets and arm bands)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Oliver, you are very welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ambassador shakes the Colonel's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel. I'd like you to meet Mr. Colson, of our Regional Aid Division.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. COLSON, crew cut, military build, is obviously CIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Oliver is the liason officer for the U.N. peace keeping forces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul backs away unnoticed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...then marches into the busy kitchen, claps his hands to gathering of waiters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, serve the hors d'ouvres now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A waiter whispers to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Bizimungu wants to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul heads out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A luxurious lounge/club called the Kigali Club - an Afric Casablanca, complete with animal heads, a statue of a mou grand piano in the corner. Rwandan Hutu army officers, (d by their crisp khaki uniforms, in the style of the French dealers, government dignitaries, businessmen and reporter freely. The few tourists stand out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL heads to a table. The center of attention and conver General BIZIMUNGU, 40's, dressed in a crisp, heavily deco uniform, a strong figure, relaxed, in control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, this scotch is exceptional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a single malt, Glenmorangie. I thought you'd like it. Anything you need, gentlemen, let me know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Paul, talk to the coat check, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul heads for the lobby. He's intercepted by an zealous reporter BENEDICT who covers the political scene for the independent newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, Paul, a moment please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Benedict, what can I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you get me into the Ambassador's reception?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, it's a private function.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict takes out his reporters notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least tell me who is attending. The newspaper will be grateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will be grateful if you keep my name out of your newspaper. Wait here and you will see who has attended as they leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul fixes a floral arrangement as he passes then arrives room hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the coat check) Did General Bizimungu bring a briefcase?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it to the bar storeroom. Put three bottles of Glenmorangie... he writes it down on a pad)                               ...GLEN-MOR-AN-GIE, into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul moves off as the coat check scurries away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Paul, Paul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An American woman, CONNIE DENVER, rich, blonde, surgicall stands by the door of the tourism office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul walks into the tourism office. It is decorated with photos of Rwanda's single most important economic asset - silver back mountain Gorillas. There's a picture of the r Fossey next to the movie poster for "Gorillas in the Mist books and video cassettes. CONNIE DENVER's older husband, American friends wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, Paul. Our trip has been cancelled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm sorry Madame Denver, it is because of the rebels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebels? What rebels?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be stupid for Christ sake. The Watusis are invading the country. I told you not to come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tutsi rebels are far away on the border. And soon there will be peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tutsis, Watutsis they'll still shoot you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I came here to see the gorillas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will try to arrange something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The luncheon is in full swing. Paul glides in the backgro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on: The Ambassador in deep conversation with Oliver

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things will calm down when the president signs the peace agreement with the rebels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our intelligence, Mr. Ambassador, is that the Hutu government has been stockpiling weapons and are preparing a massacre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what I hear. Excuse me. Paul. Paul comes over)                                      Colonel, you know the house manager, Paul Rusesabagina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was your meal, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magnificent. reads)                                                Scottish lobster, in Rwanda. You see General what a genius this man is. You want anything, this man can get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a battalion of U.S. Marines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, General, don't ask for the impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have heard, Mr. Ambassador, that they have discovered oil here, under Lake Kivu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver bursts out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, Mr. Ambassador, Paul knows how to get anything, even U.S. troops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ambassador takes Paul's hand, shakes it warmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for a wonderful meal, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul moves away graciously, and in one smooth move checks pockets, the hundred dollar bill the ambassador palmed hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Bizimungu gazes through glass into the reception Paul shake hands and joke with the Ambassador. (He's impr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul notices the General.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The General raises his briefcase and waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul waves back. Another favor rendered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is night now. Floodlights bathe the hotel in a warm gl lamps illuminate the walkways and spread scented citronel the trees. Wild birds CALL OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul walks to the employee car park at the rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees Gregoire and another male reception clerk tossing pillbox porter's hat between them with Zozo trapped in th trying to jump and catch it. Gregoire thinks this tease i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Zozo, cockroaches can jump, some of them can fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he clerk sees Paul just as he's about to throw, miscalcul sails over Gregoire's head and lands at Paul's feet. Zozo pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (points to Gregoire) You pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregoire doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are your dish-washing skills, Gregoire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregoire bends, picks up the hat, hands it to Zozo, who w quickly. Gregoire and his friend turn to head back into t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregoire, there are no cockroaches in this hotel, do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cockroaches?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bik has walked out of the rear door and overheard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me we have cockroaches, Paul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sly smile breaks on Gregoire's face as he uses Bik's ar disappear inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Bik, it's a code word for Tutsis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I came to talk to you about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hutu-Tutsi thing. The BBC faxed to say they would be here on the sixth for the peace accords. And the U.N. wants the banquet room for that day, a reception to broadcast the signing ceremony. Can you organize monitors and check the satellite dish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bik leans slightly closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also, could you remember to use the service entrance at all times?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul hops in his car and tosses a box of Belgium chocolat next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul speeds through the streets of Kigali HUMMING along t radio and eating chocolates from the box. He passes bicyc with produce. The song on the radio ends and local news c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good Hutus of Rwanda, beware. The dictatorship of the Tutsi cockroach is near. Watch your neighbor. Identify these cockroaches. Then rise up and stamp out this murderous infestation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul turns the station.    Finds another with music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights burn in windows. Kids play soccer in dusty lots. P turns onto a residential street and slows. He HONKS twice gate to a walled compound swings open. A GUARD(old, peake feet, pathetic) stands just inside. Paul waves to him and the courtyard, two cars are already parked there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A neat bungalow and gardens behind the high wall. Paul pa out. A DOG runs and greets him, BARKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down, Pealiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His wife, TATIANA, a woman of great natural beauty, emerg house, beside her an even taller, very elegant woman, she doctor's bag and a stethoscope in her hand. This is ODETT family doctor and close friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, Odette, who is sick this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked Odette to take a look at little Anais. She has a rash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother's here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, with Fedens and the children. e wants some advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul embraces Odette warmly, kisses Tatiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must go, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will not stay for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thank you, Tatiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My best to Jean Baptiste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old guard opens the gate, Odette drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a sigh) Thomas wants advice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants your wisdom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's have dinner first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His brother-in-law THOMAS and sister-in-law FEDENS come o Paul the Patriarch. They hug. Kids run everywhere. Paul s nieces Anais (in blue) and Carine (in yellow), four years scoops them up, one in each arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Anais.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Carine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not Anais?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Anais.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Carine, that is a shame. I have a present for Anais.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anais reaches out her hand. Paul sets them on the ground, chocolate from his chocolate box, deliberately hands it t Anais jumps up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodness, I cannot tell. I guess I must find another present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a chocolate gives it to Carine, then hands out t to his children who are gathered around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowded family table. Tatiana, Paul's four children, Th Fedens, and the twins Anais and Carine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, your turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's eldest, ROGER, 12, bows his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For food and clothes, and all that grows, etc, etc. Dear Lord, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Food is passed around. Roger gobbles his down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the hurry, Roger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon has a new pet. Can I go see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't want you going on the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, papa, I have a secret path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this Simon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon, next door, the Charingas' boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homework?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he did extra chores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wash your things, and be back soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger takes off at a run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger runs to a wooden fence, gets down, moves two boards through into a path, almost a tunnel in dense reeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger crawls along his path. There's a gap a little way d shoots through it into the wide open of the neighbors yar a back window of the house and taps on it. Soon SIMON, 12 slides it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's feed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon lets Roger in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger holds a WILDLY COLORED SNAKE in a jar. Simon has a Waves the bag in front of the snake. It's forked tongue g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon hands him the bugs. Roger lifts the lid, drops one the snake strikes. The boys jump back, laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After dinner coffee for the adults. Tatiana, Thomas and F table. Paul, in his usual position, at the head, listenin Solomon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard bad things, Paul. My assistant says we should get out of Rwanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should we leave? I have a new job, things have never been better for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What good is it if we are murdered in our bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your assistant, he is Hutu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, and he is in the Hutu Power Militia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants your job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he is a friend, but he tells me to listen to the radio. All day they talk about the great slaughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That station is filth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL has listened, now he decides to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today I talked to my friend the American Ambassador and Colonel Oliver of the United Nations. They are preparing a banquet for the peace signing. The BBC are flying in their best reporters. The world is watching. There will be peace. Don't listen to this man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solomon has spoken. Fedens smiles, Tatiana rubs Paul's ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger crawls along his grass tunnel. Then he hears someth through the reeds toward the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HE SEES: Military boots, a cluster of Hutu soldiers in th Khaki uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hears whispering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, Tatiana, are by Thomas's car. They say good night t guests. Anais and Carine sleep in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul nods to the old guard to go open the gate. Just then from the thicket, wide-eyed, afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul nods to Tatiana to take Roger inside. Thomas and Fed sleeping twins from their car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul goes to his big metal gates and peers through the tw

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: between the gate hinge and the gate post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HE SEES: (two houses down) the group of Hutu soldiers, cl jeeps, they whisper and point. It's a raid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now they move rushing out of view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sounds of SPLINTERING WOOD, GLASS BREAKING, CHILDREN' SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly there's a face, beside Paul's. It's Tatiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks, sees the soldiers, as they drag a middle-aged street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is crying, pleading, like a whipped dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God, it's Victor. Why do they want Victor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch as Victor is beaten to the jeep. At this point it completely, stops pleading, grabs on to a soldier, cli screaming like a terrified child - like a man who knows h die. It's a horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call your friends in the army. Call someone. Victor is harmless. This is a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana, moves toward the gate handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to talk to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul grabs her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul takes her by the arm, leads her to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you have us do? Argue with these madmen? We cannot interfere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas and Fedens wait, anxious, as Paul appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better stay the night, it is too dangerous to be on the streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana hides her anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll fix a bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul lies in bed unable to sleep.   The clock reads 3:00

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you call your contacts in the army?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could have asked for a favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I could not. What do you know about favors Tatiana, about barter and deals? All day long I work to please this officer, that diplomat, this tourist. To store up favors so that if there is a time when my family need help I have powerful people I can call upon. Now you would have me waste a precious favor on a stranger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor was not a stranger, he was our neighbor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was not family. Family is all that matters. Do you think if you or I were being dragged from here, any one of them would lift a finger to help us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do not have your connections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connections? I have no connections, only favors. If I call to help Victor, a General will think "Paul Rusesabagina is a fool. He thinks my favors are so numerous and so insignificant as to waste them on everybody." Then my hard work is doubly squandered. I insult the General and I do not get to use my favor at all. Please leave these things to my good judgment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His turn away indicates the discussion is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's car rolls up to the hotel's guard house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER THE TITLE: APRIL 6th, 1994.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An army jeep is parked just inside. General Bizimungu is passenger seat, talking into a walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The General gives an I'll see you soon wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hotel entrance is a mini-jam of airport buses, white foreign news crew Land Rovers, and a TV repair van unload Paul marches in, past Zozo the bell hop, who helps the TV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lobby buzzes with activity. At the reception, Gregoir surrounded by a BBC news crew: GLORIA, young, chic female reporter/producer, and JOCK, tough, experienced Scottish his local sound guy Peter. Gloria is upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We reserved five rooms not two

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, ma'am, but I see only two here in the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jock sees Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, how the hell are ya'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am delighted to see you, Mr. Daglish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They moved you from the Diplomat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promoted. House Manager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moves closer)                                           We're having a little trouble, Paul. We booked five rooms, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul moves behind the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He punches into the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, I see the mistake. You were reading CBC - the Canadian broadcasting people instead of BBC Gregoire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on the computer: It clearly states BBC - two rooms. looks to Paul with a mix of puzzlement and anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, the BBC, five rooms. (lies)                                                   They are being prepared as we speak. I have ordered fresh flowers and complimentary champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria picks up her bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, I really need a shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me a moment to get your keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul better come up with three rooms fast. Then he spots Benedict hovering at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gloria) Excuse me for one second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul hurries over to Benedict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict, you should meet the BBC people. They could use your expertise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict is delighted. They head back across the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whisper)                                                 Benedict, General Bizimungu will be here any moment. The BBC should talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They join the BBC team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame, this is Benedict Nangori, one of our best journalists. He covers all the big stories. I thought you should meet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria, a consummate news producer, turns on the charm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict, beautiful name. I'm Gloria Fleming. BBC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul moves off to the desk, Gregoire can barely disguise

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no more rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregoire hands it over. Paul dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame Denver. I have very good news. I have a present for you, in return for the cancellation of your gorilla expedition I have arranged a safari at Lake Kivu lodge. A wonderful experience. No, no extra charge. A luxury coach will leave in one hour. I'll send maids up to help you all pack. You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul hangs up, turns to Gregoire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call Kivu Lodge, ask for George, tell him I need three rooms. And send a team of maids up to the Americans. I want those rooms turned around in twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL heads for the glass doors and sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Bizimungu, briefcase in hand, gives the tv interv confident, controlled Benedict stands close by as Gloria

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are rumors, General, that your army, the Hutu army, consider these peace accords a sellout to the Tutsi rebels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Nonsense. At this moment we are making plans to rehabilitate the dissidents into our armed forces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the army fully supports the president as he signs the peace agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, the president is a clever man, he knows what he is doing. Thank you for coming to Rwanda. (on the move). You will see what a beautiful country this is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul turns, walks past porters ferrying the BBC luggage. hand out. Gregoire hands him keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul does his rounds. He double checks the banquet room w technicians install several TV monitors and test the sign

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks in the kitchen, frenzied activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanders behind the bar. Everything is 'under control'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He returns to the lobby, greets Connie, her flustered hus friends, followed by a team of porters and luggage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive the hurry but I do not want you to miss the lunch buffet on the paddle steamer across the lake. It is the most spectacular sight in all Africa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lunch? All we do is eat. I thought there was famine in Africa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly, we can't have our guests starving. What would they think of the Mille Collines back in the United States?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gen. Bizimungu, takes Paul's arm, pulls him aside, hands briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep that cockroach Benedict away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the General disappears into the bar, Paul waves over t hands her the briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same as last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods, hurries off just as the BBC crew appears. Paul keys, greets each.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fifth room is your broadcast room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I'd like to book a massage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jock, the Scottish cameraman, hangs behind as the others his key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you bring any of those wee girls who used to sit at the bar in the Diplomat with you? You know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Daglish, this is the Mille Collines. No working girls here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we phone them in, Paul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I can't do that, Mr. Daglish. Ah, Zozo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul calls Zozo over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember Zozo, from the Diplomat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jock gets the code instantly, as Zozo smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zozo! The very man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Scot and Zozo greet, then hurry off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul supervises waiters hanging a banner.   It reads "Pea Brotherhood! UNAMIR 1994".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reporters watch rows of TVs. All broadcast the signing of Accords. (Reporters have political chatter.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: the TVs as President Habyarimana signs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As president Habyarimana signs a peace accord between the Tutsi rebels and his Hutu army there remains strong doubts that the extremist Hutu Power will abide by the accords. But for now hope has returned to Rwanda for the first time in many years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the African reporters in the room CHEER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fireworks go off outside the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Oliver raises a glass of champagne and leads the toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room as one raise their glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Paul as he nods to a member of the tribal band stage. Then, African drummers hammer out a fast uplifting full troupe of ceremonial dancers skip into the room in c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul checks out the banques. They appear empty, then a vo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, join us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's General Bizimungu, he is sitting with George Rutagun shiny blue suit. A bottle of whiskey on the table is almo Bizimungu and Rutagunda watch the peace celebration acros

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pours. George points his glass toward the Europeans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at them, they want to see the tribes dance to their tune. Here is our dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rutagunda staggers to his feet, launches into a drunken v Hutu Militia War Dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Paul. Show them our dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul takes George's arm, does two steps of the dance, the stumble and shoulder bumps the big man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George falls into his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me, George, my step was off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rutagunda bursts out laughing, toasts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To our president. May he find peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Paul is forced to join in the toast, Rutagunda laughs, smiles at some insider joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reporters and crews pack up their equipment. Paul shakes porters to pick up cases. Then a porter whispers a messag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul emerges, discovers Fedens and Thomas - they look emb in such exulted surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive us, Paul. We must talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are leaving Rwanda, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to the terrace, I will join you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drinks are served at a table as Paul listens to Thomas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My assistant, the Hutu Power man, says we should get out now, that soon it will be very bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul stifles his anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me this man's name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Naramaranga, but please, Paul, even though he is Hutu Power, he is a friend, he likes me. He told me there is a signal. It is "Cut the tall trees." When they hear the signal, the militia are to go to war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, let us take Tatiana with us. You are Hutu, you will be safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas, Fedens, I am a man who looks after his family. If there were danger I would be the first to leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG - a distant explosion, a flash of light on the far s city. Fedens jumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm yourself, it is fireworks to celebrate the peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Paul, tomorrow I will bring you my car. You will sell it for me and get a fair price. We will go to Tanzania until there is real peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Paul, you have a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zozo hands Paul a cordless phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ello. Tatsi. Yes, they are here. Yes. I know but I want them to calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS and Fedens listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already the press are packing their bags. The BBC man told me there's no story here. We are boring now. I'll be home soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us all go home and sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul escorts Fedens and Thomas to their car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call when you get home.   And don't worry, Thomas. Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's at the wheel, driving. A thick mist. Barely a car Shadows dart past faint house lights. The windscreen clou switches on his wipers. A Toyota truck, loaded with Milit from the mist, speeds past. Paul switches the preset butt radio as he drives. He can only find fevered drum-based M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul turns onto his street. The houses are dark: windows gates closed; not a soul about. Paul stops before his gat twice. The gate doesn't open. He hops out and opens it wi Gives it a push and pauses as he heads back to the car. H far off sound of gunfire. Distant explosions light the ni

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul drives in. His compound is curiously dark.     His h across his pitch-black house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gates swing shut. We PULL BACK as Paul turns and face Paul whistles for the dog, nothing. He goes back to the c flashlight, heads for the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door slowly opens. Paul steps in quietly, tries the l nothing. He listens. The only sounds are distant explosio gunfire. The beam of his flashlight cuts the blackness, i magazines arranged on a coffee table; an empty chair; chi in a basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul continues his search. Scans the counter. There's foo stove. The table is set. He hears a GROWL, quickly cut sh of the bedrooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul shines the light into a room. Looks for a second, th door, and walks to the next. He stops and listens with hi door. Nothing. He pushes it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's light sweeps across the room and illuminates:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes - terrified eyes, a room full of faces, staring back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEIR POV: A dark figure behind a blinding light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog breaks free, runs to Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pealiss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From among the faces, Tatiana's voice heavy with relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's eyes adjust, he recognizes many of his neighbors, into this small room. Then he sees their friends Odette a Jean Baptiste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean Baptiste!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our house has been burned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The president has been murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murdered! By whom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The radio says Tutsi rebels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonsense. Why would the rebels kill the president when he agreed to peace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana pulls Paul aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are Thomas and Fedens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sent them home. Go and call them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried already. The phones do not work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean Baptiste turns on his tiny radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our great president is murdered, by the Tutsi cockroaches. They tricked him, then they killed him. We must cleanse this country, Good Hutus of Rwanda. We must clear the brush. Clear the brush of all cockroaches. Clear the brush!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words are cut short as a grenade blast rattles the wi jumps, children whimper. Paul is shocked but tries to pul together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, everyone out of this room, find a seat in the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds the door open, they file out, frightened. Tatian stops her, steps back in, closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in hushed anger) Is every Tutsi in the neighborhood here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They came through the bushes, over the wall. What could I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send them home. We are not the police. What do we have to protect them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Let them stay 'til morning. The militia will not come here, they know you are a Hutu with influence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They know you are Tutsi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door knocks.   Paul gets up, angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Paul, 'til first light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawn. Then they go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul opens the door, it's Odette, holding the hand of Pau daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me, Paul. Danielle says that Roger has gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana comes over instantly, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gone where? Tell me, Danielle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their daughter Danielle answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next door, mama. He was afraid for his friend Simon. He went to fetch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger crawls between the shrubs.      He hears ANGRY VOIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He peers through the long grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sees: Hutu soldiers boots, feet in sneakers, bare women's among them the glint of machetes, hoes, a club spiked wit length of chain CLANGING on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana rushes out the front door, Paul after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul catches her and puts his hand over her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOUTS next door. Paul pulls Tatiana behind the car. A be SHOUTS. Paul takes his hand from her mouth. She's sobbing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger crawls to the gap in the shrubs. Feet, a crowd, lea a gate. Engines rev.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Then he hears BRANCHES SNAPPING. He moves toward the sound. Discovers Roger, terrified, thrashing in a tangle of bush He grabs Rogers shirt, pulls him as the little boy startl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you hurt, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oger stares blankly. Odette is beside them now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands pull and tear his clothes off. Towels wipe him down looks all over his body with the flashlight. Despite the has no injuries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened, son? Where did you get this blood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Roger, trembling, just stares, totally traumatized. C

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not injured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His paralysis freaks the women in the room. Paul turns an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave us, give us some space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ushers the neighbors out of the room, closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tatiana) The neighbors must go at dawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana hugs her son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The faintest grey of dawn over the city. Then a flock of one in the distance. A millisecond later, the cause of th grenade explosion, echoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The birds dart, in another direction as the STACCATO of a rips the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL sits on the edge of the bed, staring out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him Tatiana has Roger cradled in her arms, he stil wide eyed as she tries to get him to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you take a little milk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door knocks. The old guard calls in frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tatiana) It is time for the neighbors to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul steps out, closes the door behind him. A small deleg men wait nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up the tiny radio, tuned to the BBC World servic Brit voice. (It's Gloria the reporter.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hutu president's plane was struck by a ground-to-air missile as he returned from signing the peace accord with the Tutsi rebels. There were no survivors. The Hutu government has already blamed the Tutsi rebels. The rebels have denied the accusation. Already there are reports of reprisal killings on the streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they listen, a young woman lets out a SQUEAL, and flee where she's been sitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hysteria in the room, women and children push toward the manages to make it to the window, nervously steals a glan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: anic in the room now. Paul turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL'S POV: The soldiers drop into his garden. They draw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay with the children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL'S POV: The soldiers go to the gate, slide the bolt,

dialogues.text: Two jeeps, jammed with heavily armed SOLDIERS, sit in the many-limbed beasts of war. Paul watches as the jeeps rumb garden. The soldiers jump out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing can stop the women and children from fleeing into Paul is frozen at the CRASH of rifles on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door gives, SOLDIERS flood in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are startled by the crowd in the living room, rifles SHOUTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out, get out now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul pulls himself together, marches over to the soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is in charge?

dialogues.text: A Captain is at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Paul Rusesabagina, a good friend of General Bizimungu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes Paul by the arm, leads him outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain stops by his jeep, studies his clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana with Roger in her arms, her kids and all the neig together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see your identity card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul pulls it from his pocket, hands it to the Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Paul's ID - it reads Ethnicity: HUTU.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain studies him, waves for the soldiers to back o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard the Tutsi cockroaches murdered our president.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is a calamity for us all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You work at the Hotel Diplomat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I work at the Mille Collines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain looks confused. Paul quickly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to work at the Diplomat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how to open the safe there? (Paul nods) Our government needs to use the hotel and the room keys are in the safe. You must open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul sees out into the street behind the jeeps: a group o their colored shirts armed with machetes, have gathered, what is going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, I must take my family. It is not safe here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is your family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana is beside him now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts) This is them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana points to the huddled neighbors. Paul is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of them! I cannot take them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, good Captain, you do not have to. We have the car and our van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to the Mille Collines van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he Captain looks doubtful, then his two-way radio barks - message. He listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana drags the kids and ushers everyone toward the van they are all clambering in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul jumps behind the wheel of the van. Neighbors are jam sardines, 15, more, inside. Tatiana and their kids are sq together on the front bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy (jeep - van, car - jeep) starts up and turns o street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Militia men wave sticks, machetes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul looks back as they speed off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sees: The Militia looters pour into his gateway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they pass the Caringa home, Militia looters carry off a stove on a child's skateboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TATIANA has Roger on her lap, she cradles his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy speeds through the deserted streets. Slowing o maneuver through makeshift roadblocks where Militia wave nailed clubs and spears as they dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FURTHER ALONG THE ROAD: a group of Militia swarm over a c the windshield, the windows. Inside a family huddles toge terror, waiting for the windows to give way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the gutter by the side of the road, three dead bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tatiana)                                              Don't look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy pulls up at this older, shabbier hotel. There jeeps, and several staff in a panic. The janitor, ROBERT, bursts into waves of joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Paul, sir. Oh, Mr. Paul. We must open every door right now for the government.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul jumps out of the van, hurries to the lead jeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Captain)                                          The safe is in the manager's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain nods to two soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go with him, get the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul runs through the lobby. The staff look petrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul bursts into the room. The two soldiers follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to the hotel's big old combination safe, spins th a few times, tries the handle, clunk! It doesn't open. He the number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers look at him impatiently. Paul improvises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, you'll find some chocolate, and maybe a few beers in the fridge. Don't let them go to waste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers fall over each other to get to the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul tries the safe numbers again, clunk! It opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees: a big bunch of keys, a wad of dollars, Rwandan f book, and several bottles of the best cognac, whiskey, so

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks round nervously but the two soldiers are busy fi the beer and chocolates in the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: s they do, Paul, hands trembling, stuffs the wads of note belt, pulls his shirt over and shuts the safe door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is about to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul looks back at the soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul sits, as the two soldiers guzzle beers and stuff cho their pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul hurries through the lobby toward the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul emerges to see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of the occupants of the van, Tatiana, his kids, Odett knees, with their hands on their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain hovers over them, pistol in hand, turns, sees marches toward him and SLAPS HIM HARD on the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traitor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul reels from the blow, but manages to stay on his feet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain snatches a bunch of ID cards from a soldier, cards in Paul's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are all Tutsi cockroaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs Paul by the scruff of the neck, pushes him towar captives. The Captain snatches a pistol from one of his s shoves it into Paul's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOOT THEM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I don't use guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is nothing to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain raises his own pistol and FIRES it. Everyone fright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot them now or you die first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain aims his pistol at Paul's head. Cocks the ham

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, what could I pay you not to do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to pay me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? These are not rebels, look at them. Soon they will be worthless to you. Why not take some money, for your work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name a price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten thousand francs for each one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have that much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain laughs, snatches the gun from Paul, marches t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul reaches into his pocket, pulls out the bunch of doll

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, here, a thousand US dollars - fifty thousand francs for my family. To let us drive off to the Mille Collines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many in your family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain looks at his soldiers, at the wad of notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull your family out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul runs over, grabs Tatiana, Roger, the three girls. Od beside Tatiana. Paul whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you any money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul pushes his family toward the van, looks back, sees t pocket the dollars, move toward the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, don't let them die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgent) Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul pushes them into the van, shuts the door, digs into all the courage he can muster, then turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, let these people give you some money, whatever they have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain hesitates. Paul sees this, runs over to the l neighbors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me everything, everything you have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pathetic rain of Rwandan francs, useless coins, watches falls onto the ground. Paul scoops it all up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he Captain looks at it, takes it, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is only enough for one cockroach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain raises his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pick one to take with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now each terrified neighbor looks to Paul, begging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul counts the kneeling figures: ten adults, four kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And four children?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you a hundred thousand francs for all of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain points the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have it here. At the Mille Collines. I can get it for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will run into the hotel and hide behind the U.N.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear, Captain, one hundred thousand francs, enough for a house. I will get the money, you keep them outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will keep your family outside. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy pulls up at the outer gates of the Mille Colli manned by ARMED UN PEACEKEEPERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he Captain walks to Paul in the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go with my soldiers. And hurry back if you want to keep these cockroaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain nods to Paul's children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul jumps into the Rwandan army jeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to UN Peacekeepers) I am the manager. Open the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos - UN jeeps, hotel vans, dismayed tourists, frighten refugees.

dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Bik, the Dutch manager, bag packed, anxious, se YELLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, I have to talk to you ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Paul ignores Bik, barrels his way through the din and parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul rushes in:   The lobby is filled with Tutsi refugees white tourists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: solitary receptionist, besieged by anxious guests, is rel Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sir, please can you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul rushes to the accounting room behind the reception d the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul pulls bundles of dollars from the hotel safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul pushes through the mob at the door. Bik comes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul... grabs Paul)                                               ...I have to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul breaks free and hurries over to the Army jeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hops in) Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul jumps from the jeep. Waves to Tatiana in the van, th money to the Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now let them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. Money in hand, the Captain eyes Paul with ma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be foolish. There's more money to be made here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to buy anymore cockroaches ask for Captain Naramunju.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain smiles, then jumps in his jeep and speeds off the van and jumps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jubilation, in the rear of the van. Odette is in tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, thank you, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul doesn't reply. Tatiana hugs him. He gives her a look relief and anger - the crowd in the back almost cost him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's van arrives. Bik hangs from a minibus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts) Paul, I have to go. The staff have fled Kivu Lodge. I have to close it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flings office keys to Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While I'm away, you're in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bik's van takes off. A group of tourists hears Bik's word

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, we need our passports, we want to get a flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul looks at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in your safety boxes. We need them right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the desk, the same receptionist is overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in charge, that's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul goes behind the desk. Rumors fly among the crowd of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staccato) to the airport...my embassy ...tried to call... the airport is closed ... refund... this is outrageous ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the tourists, Tatiana and the neighbors look lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul addresses the frightened Western tourists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I am the house manager. Return in thirty minutes and we will deal with all your requests, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul turns to the room key boxes, nearly all are empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to all the rooms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally he finds a key, pushes through to Tatiana, hands Odette and Jean Baptiste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take this room. Tatiana, bring the children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul starts to lead his family away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: neighbors) What about them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul looses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Them. They almost got us all killed. I have done enough for them! We cannot look after them anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do? You cannot drive them out onto the road. They can stay with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not have them on my conscience. They will stay in my room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Zozo) Zozo, get a key for two staff bedrooms. Put these people in them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul hurries his family along the corridor. Rwandan refug aimlessly pulling their meagre possessions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls out)                                             Moses, Moses Seradungu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for Moses Seradungu's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is his room number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go downstairs, I will help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul finds his room and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL leads his family into a one-bedroom suite. The kids beds exhausted. Tatiana picks up the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying Thomas and Fedens. We've got to get them here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul paces the room. The maids clearly haven't cleaned it last occupants: the beds are unmade; towels are on the fl newspaper is scattered across the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: room) This won't do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will do just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Paul tidies the place. As he does,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any luck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. Please send someone to get them, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul waits, then a car pulls up, an Indian businessman, M gets out, shakes hands, he's shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrible times, Paul. There are bodies everywhere. I cannot stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a great favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Mr. Garindi an address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to go to this address and bring my brother-in-law and his family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. This is a very dangerous part of town. I cannot do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
