dialogues.text: This would be an enormous favor to me. I am a man of means, Mr. Garandi. When this nonsense is over I will be most grateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will see what I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Garindi climbs back into his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul stops just shy of the lobby. Around the corner is a guests. Paul takes a moment to gather himself: straighten button his jacket; flick a piece of lint from his shoulde takes a breath and steps around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for your patience, ladies and gentlemen. Now, how can I help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mob rushes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul works the front desk as angry guests surge all aroun emerges from the office with two tourists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the receptionists? Where's Gregoire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has taken the presidential suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul storms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A door with a placard reading "Presidential Sui knocks. The door opens. Gregoire answers, half-naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Mr. Manager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregoire, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of this room and get back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to listen to you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am in charge now. Get back to work or I'll fire you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me ask you Mr. Manager, do you notice a smell of cockroaches? If I were to leave this room, I'm sure I could find this smell. I know people who could cleanse it.(stares) But maybe it doesn't bother you? Why is that? Are used to this smell? Not me, I need a clean room to escape it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregoire closes the door. Paul's eyes burn with anger, bu will have to wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul comes into the lobby and discovers Colonel Oliver, h a tall, well-dressed man, the Tutsi Minister of Finance X family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, you know who this is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Colonel Monsieur Xavier, the Minister of Finance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him a room, but tell no one he is here. (to Xavier) Paul will look after you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will need a suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves over to Zozo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the key to suite twelve, take these people there right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a commotion by the door. Paul goes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A valet stops a group of Tutsi refugees from entering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, they have no reservations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul studies the group, - a ragged bunch, no way are they Collines guest material.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, sir, we have nowhere else to go. They're hunting us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said everyone go over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul sees: UN Colonel Oliver giving an interview to the B the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul approaches the BBC reporter Gloria and Colonel Olive interview concludes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we know who fired the missile that killed the president?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But I fear it's intention may have been to kill the peace accords and spark a civil war between the Hutu Militia and the Tutsi rebels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've heard reports of reprisal killings. Will the UN intervene to stop the bloodshed.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately we're here as peace-keepers not peace makers, we can't take an aggressive role.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the UN changes your mandate could you stop the bloodshed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. With some re-inforcements I'm confident we could impose order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you requested re-enforcements?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes we have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the response?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're awaiting a decision, excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Oliver shakes Gloria's hand then moves off toward

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, I've sent my soldiers to rescue the Lady Prime Minister, she'll need a room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir, but these people (points) they cannot stay here. I've heard you have a refugee center at the airport Stadium?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I can't possibly take them Paul. I'm overrun with refugees. As soon as we can stabilize the situation we'll take them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL moves to the door, where Jock and Gloria argue besid with the word `press' spelt out in tape on the wind sreen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For fuck's sake, Gloria There's a big news story out there! We need to get out and cover it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going outside the hotel grounds unless we have an armored car. That's the ground rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ground rules! Where the fuck do you think you are, Wimbledon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cover the story from here until we can get proper protection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul works his way through the crowds in the lobby, sees dishes by an elevator, looks around, can't see any staff. pushes the trolley himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul pushes the trolley into the deserted kitchen. At the several cooks listen to the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Good Hutus, we must destroy an infestation of cockroaches at the technical college.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn that off. We have a hotel to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cooks halfheartedly slouch back to the sinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lobby is overflowing with refugees. Paul stands with Zozo walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Zozo) Where's housekeeping? They won't pick up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, no one wants to work. They say the boss has left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul heads for the back office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A neat corporate office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several executive officers sit across from Sabena Preside around a speaker phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have your name again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul Rusesabagina, Mr. Godefroid. The house manager. I met you on your last visit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Paul, I remember. The Mille Collines is a very important property for Sabena. Our directors believe we should close down, shutter the place until this unrest is over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is really bad news. Paul can't allow them to close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, that would be very bad for our reputation. We are an oasis of calm for all our loyal customers. What would they think if Sabena deserted them now? (lies) I assure you the United Nations has everything under control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. But if this thing gets worse, we must close. If there's anything you need, call anytime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is one thing I need right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul waits by the fax, then it spits out a single page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every member of the hotel staff is gathered together. Pau them as Zozo hands out copies of a fax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my letter of appointment, signed by Mr. Godefroid, the president of Sabena. The Mille Collines is a five star establishment, we will run it that way. If you don't want to work for me, then leave now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the hallways cleaned now, a menu prepared for the dining room. Where's the pianist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand goes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you on the piano in the Kigali Room tonight. Back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul emerges to find more refugees, some settled on the l gathered in clumps by the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul calls over to the valet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take these people to the rear car park, they can't stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly women and children on the lawn scream and run in them bushes shake, then suddenly a bloody figure wearing shorts bursts out from among the trees and flees to the m driveway. It's the journalist, BENEDICT, covered in blood been chopped off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PANDEMONIUM. As Paul runs to him, calls to Zozo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get Odette!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul grabs Benedict, tries to calm him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're killing everyone. The Lady Minister! The UN soldiers. They're at the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points down the driveway. This sparks many of the wome and white guests, to flee inside the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Odette arrives with her bag, leads Benedict inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jock has been filming all of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Jock runs, camera still on his shoulder, toward the g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul takes off after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More Tutsi refugees running up the driveway in fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jock films, Paul arrives by the gate house. UN soldier outside road. Engines roar, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A convoy of Toyota trucks circle on the road outside the Militia men on the back wave spears, machetes, one, in a wig, waves a cordless power drill. The drill bit is red w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the next truck, TWO Militia MEN triumphantly taunt the as they hold blue UN helmets high on sticks. The helmets through with holes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We kill UN. We kill you next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENRAGED UN SOLDIERS cock their weapons, aim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A UN armored car races past the Militia and turns into th The back door opens, UN Colonel Oliver jumps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold the line here. Do not shoot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Colonel stabilizes the situation, his men watch the m by. Paul approaches Oliver

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They murdered my soldiers. Ten Belgians who I sent to get the lady minister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver shakes his head. He helps Paul clamber into the ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul follows Oliver as he marches through the lobby. Seve surround them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true about the Belgian soldiers... Are all ten dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul watches the UN command disappear into an elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul is in the corridor, talking to Tatiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has Roger spoken yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Odette says he's in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can we help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs to be in a safe place. (a beat) Have you heard from Mr. Garindi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a clank of metal. Paul looks and sees: A waiter struggling with a trolley of food by a door. He hurries to help the waiter as Jock opens, indicates qu Paul and the waiter in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is set up as a make-shift broadcast center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria is on a phone to the BBC in London, she hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we're feeding through live now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fixes her outfit, sits straight up in the chair. Behi monitors show footage of a plane crash and bodies along r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay London .... and five four three two one ...That's correct Tom. Today's gruesome ambush of a ten man Belgian patrol has left the UN peacekeeping force in a state of disarray. Its commander has called for re-enforcements. However, the General Council is deeply divided. The United States, still smarting from the UN's disastrous Somalia mission, has indicated that it will veto any moves to reinforce. Meanwhile, the slaughter goes on. Gloria Brooks in Kigali, Rwanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria on the phone, listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, cut ...good, give me a call guys, let me know you've got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jock turns to Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect timing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This goes out live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jock points skyward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satellite feed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. (listens) No kidding,  When will they be here? Excellent. Yes, call then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The news room has heard that the French and the Belgians are putting together an intervention force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When will they be here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jock's is at the window scanning with his camera, getting he sees something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Peter, hook me back into the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jock's filming as Peter makes the connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit! Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jock focuses

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the monitor: blurry focus of a shanty town on a hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOW FOCUS: Of a crowd hovering close to a group of Rwanda seated on the ground. Two Militia emerge from the crowd, machetes. They SLASH their way along the line, savage, po butchering people like cattle.          (Author note: we news footage of this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking see that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shock) Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Screen: The crowd run off, waving machetes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria snaps out of her shock, snatches the phone, dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Gloria. Listen we've footage, unbelievable footage! A massacre! Machetes, murderers, dead bodies. You have to lead with this. We'll send it through right now. Wait 'til you see this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts the phone down, turns to the others, triumphant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An embarrassed silence in the room. Jock is disgusted by picks up a plate from the trolley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gloria) Here, have a sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She storms out. Paul fills the embarrassed silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you filmed this. Now the West will have to stop it. Excuse me, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The businessman Mr. Garindi knocks on room 211. Paul open sees him, then turns back to Tatiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatsi, come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatsi appears at the door with several of the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the kids) Go back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids do as they're told. Paul and Tatsi shut the door businessman in the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find the twins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana clings to Paul, fearful of the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made it to the house but it was empty. It had been robbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there blood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No blood. As I left a neighbor, an old woman, waved to me. I went to her house. She has the little girls. They are safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother, his wife. Did this woman know of them? Did they leave the children with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The businessman shakes his head no. Tears run down Tatian holds Paul's arm to stop from falling to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not bad news, Tatsi. Perhaps they fled or could not make it home. There is hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the businessman) Please go back, bring the children to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frightened)No ma'am, I cannot do that. The roadblocks are everywhere. They are looking for children. They shout, "Kill the babies to clear the infestation." Leave them be, they are safe. I have to go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul takes a small wad of notes from his pocket, presses businessman's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves. Tatiana pulls Paul to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sister is dead, Paul. They would not leave the children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. They are not dead. Stop this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Tatiana push through the French tourists and AID running across the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mon Dieu, Merci.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheers break out. Paul and Tatsi peer from the crowd and lobby window see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: French and Italian special forces pull into the parking l tall in their jeeps, macho western super troops, triumpha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wild cheering, flowers draped around necks, kisses. Weste Rwandans, dance and sing in celebration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul SEES: Colonel Oliver off to the side, with the comma French special forces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a battalion, you could stop this now. The Hutu army is no match for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are not our orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver pulls off his blue beret, throws it on the ground, finger at the French and Italian officers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will remember this day for the rest of your lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks off, returns, picks up his beret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul watches as he storms into the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul follows the Colonel into the Kigali Club. The place bartender missing, gone to celebrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel, what can I get you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul gets behind the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything. Strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Canadian Club?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver cracks a weary smile. Paul pours two drinks, slide He raises his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Colonel. You have saved us all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raw cynicism) Congratulations. You should spit in my face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think you are dirt, less than dirt, worthless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bullshit me, Paul. You're the smartest man here. You have them all eating out of your hand. You'd own this fucking hotel, except for one thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fucking black! You're not even a nigger, you're African! (downs his drink) They're not staying to stop this thing. They're gonna fly right out of here with their people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked) Their people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're only taking the whites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul opens the door. Tatiana and the kids pack bags, prep

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Children, go into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana and the children stop what they're doing, puzzled

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the kids) Please, go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul takes her hands in his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the whites are leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana's grip tightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are being evacuated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have been abandoned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana clings to hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers will stop the killers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul looses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me woman. I said all the whites are leaving. The French, the Italians, even the Belgian UN soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But who is left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Colonel Oliver says the UN has three hundred soldiers for the whole country. Black soldiers, Pakistanis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most the Colonel can spare for the hotel are four men, and they're not allowed to shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her hand, makes her sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anything should happen, if the Militia arrive, you must take the children and go to the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana's eyes are wide with fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul takes his anger out on Tatiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what I say, woman. You hear me? I will meet you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He storms out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL: A chaos of luggage, white tourists, AID agency pe and French soldiers, elite, slick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the edges, clumps of Rwandans, watching, silent, fearf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A torrential African rain storm soaks everything. Porters umbrellas run the white evacuees to the buses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: French and Italian commanders check off names on clipboar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jock films the evacuees boarding buses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the front desk, Paul, dripping wet from working the co to a French tourist who refuses to pay his bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should I pay to stay in a, in a holocaust? Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, stone-faced, polite, destroys this asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not staying sir, you are leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul watches in the rain as the final agency people are b onto buses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several white aid workers weep uncontrollably as they are from frightened Rwandan coworkers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL in the rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cross the parking lot Colonel Oliver watches from his jee Jock and his sound man embrace two beautiful young HOOKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One girl begs Jock to take her with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, please, they will put me on the street. They will chop me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darlin', believe me, if I could...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He digs in his pockets, pulls out money, cigarettes. Ever he gives to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he pulls her toward Paul, digs out his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes two Visa cards into Paul's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give her what she wants, room, food, anything. Charge it all. Don't you put her out, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would never do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that, Paul. I'm sorry. Here take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jock pulls a Rolex off his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a Rolex, I can't take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it for Christ sake. I wish it was a fucking aeroplane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jock embraces Paul, tears in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria watches from the doorway. Embarrassed by Jock, She officious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, Jock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns on her) Go! What the fuck sort of journalists are we, running from a war? I'm ashamed. Are you? Well, are ya'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gloria marches onto the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to a French soldier) What are we waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to evacuate some nuns from a convent. They are on their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jock kisses the hooker, heaves his camera onto the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then there is a disturbance on the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of French nuns, along with maybe a hundred Tutsi children come running up the driveway. They are all terri leads them with a French flag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: French soldiers run forward. A commander orders them to f blocking the refugees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: French soldiers begin pulling nuns from the terrified cro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several nuns begin hysterically weeping, pulling Rwandan them. Panic breaks out among the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jock grabs his camera, pushes off the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nuns cling to young children. French soldiers wrench the lift them off their feet, carry them to the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOCK films, as A FRENCH OFFICER screams at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last nun is dragged onto a bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jock looks to Paul, then gets on the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy - French jeeps, buses, Italian jeeps, UN jeeps through the refugees, turns a corner, gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, drenched, is left alone to fend for his new guests: Weeping women, frightened children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy passes the gate house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the road, two jeeps of Rwandan Army soldiers watch leave. They get on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where five minutes before the lobby was a frenzy of wealt and aid workers, the groups of clustered black faces are for the crying of babies and sobbing mothers. Paul picks them. Zozo catches up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do with all these people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open up the ballroom, we'll put them there. And Zozo tell the kitchen to make rice and beans - a lot of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul enters, drops to the bed. Tatiana curls up next to h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could leave, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying, Tatsi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your card says Hutu. Take our children, go and get the twins, pay money at the roadblocks. Get them out. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough of this. We stay together. Let me rest, I will feel better then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul puts on his walkman earphones, presses play, the ric of Don Williams singing ???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on: Paul as his eyes droop and to the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A kalidiscope of colors filter through drooping eyelids a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on Paul's face, as the music plays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes open wide, disturbed, music playing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's POV, an Army lieutenant stands over him, other sol

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lieutenant reaches down, pulls the earphones from Pau

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are the manager?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. What is wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone must leave the hotel now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an order. Get everyone out now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...ah...need some time. Please give us twenty, thirty minutes. People are sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lieutenant is not impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, have some cold drinks. I will be as quick as I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cold drinks' softens the soldiers' attitudes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will be outside, ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers march off. Paul goes back inside. The kids, menace, sit still and wide-eyed on the floor. Suddenly Ta Roger is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Roger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danielle points to under the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger trembling under the bed, as Paul's face appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on son, everything is all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slides him out, clutches him in his arms, then turns h Tatiana as he phones the front desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Who is this? Zozo. I know. Get them beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to Tatiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to the roof now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified) What for Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forceful) Do as I say. I will be there soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hurries out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's door opens, his head appears round the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The corridor is empty of soldiers. Now, frightened Tutsis their rooms. A group of men, among them the politician Xa gathered in the hallway. Paul spots one man holding a pis up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the man with the pistol) Are you mad? They will gun us all down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better to die by the bullet than the machete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul pulls the gun off him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait here, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul hands the gun to Xavier, hurries off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul bursts in, sits by the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good day, General Bizimungu please. Do you know where he is? Please ask him to call Paul Rusesabagina. It is urgent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phone again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERIES OF FLASH CUTS: increasingly frantic calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Bagsora. Where? Can you find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who would order such a thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find the General?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul hangs up the phone defeated. He looks at his watch. onto the desk, onto the Sabena logo. He sees it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sabena president and two VPs sit on couches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If British Airways abandons the route we should bid for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His intercom buzzes, he's annoyed then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir. I have a call from Paul in Kigali. He says it's urgent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The president goes to the phone, hits the speaker button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul. Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a big problem. The Hutu army have come and ordered us all of us out of the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The president is baffled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out? Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not know, sir. I think they will kill us all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The president can barely form words to reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All. What do you mean all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The staff, the guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The staff and guests! How many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we have eight hundred guests and one hundred staff. I have ten minutes left. I wish I could have done more, sir. Please, thank all my friends at Sabena. You have been good to me and my family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked) Paul, wait, wait, I'm going to put you on hold for one minute, stay on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits the hold button. Looks to the other executives. T stunned to silence by Paul's profound farewell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul listens to music on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pandemonium - the president has everyone working the phon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the prime minister's office. Call General Chareaux. Louis get the UN. Tell them this is Belgian property.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music is suddenly interrupted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, are you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, thank you Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, if you have one call in all the world to stop this, who would you call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The French. They supply the Rwandan army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, do everything you can to buy time. I will call you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul hurries from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zozo at the computer, printing something. Paul walks up, Hotel's Registry printing. Paul grabs it, studies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lieutenant wants the register.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes Zozo toward the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go and get more beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Paul is on the computer, typing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN: The register shows that day's date: April 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul hits a few keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN: The date above the register is April 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul hits the print button. The printer clicks to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul with the printed registry and Zozo with beer walk to The soldiers don't wait for the Captain's order, they mob beers. The lieutenant marches up to Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the guest list?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul hands him the printout. He studies it, reads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson, Arthurs, Boulier. What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guest list. It hasn't been updated since the murder of the president.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lieutenant grabs Paul by the shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you trying to make a fool of me? There are no Europeans left in that hotel. Get me the names of all the cockroaches in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That will take time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have time. If I do not have the names, so that I can pick out the traitors, then I will kill everyone here in this car park. Get in there now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul turns to walk back in. The lieutenant hurries to his beers from their hands, smashes them on the ground. One s running to him with a radio. Paul watches. The lieutenant calls to Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey you, come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did you call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lie to me. What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rusesabagina. Paul Rusesabagina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will remember that name. (turns to his soldiers) Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers roar off down the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOZO looks to Paul, a thank you Jesus look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul emerges onto the roof, sees Tatiana, his children, a neighbors sitting huddled together. (They do not know the left.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana is frozen to the spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana grabs him. Tears of joy. Paul's neighbors swarm h thank him like a messiah. This effects him. He seems genu he shakes hands and hugs them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir. The president of Sabena is on the phone for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul arrives behind the front desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul hits the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are gone. Thank you, sir. What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotfroid is at his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I managed to get the President of France on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir, you saved our lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, I pleaded with the president to go in and get you all. He told me it will not happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can give you many political answers Paul but the truth is that Africa is not worth a single vote to all of them: French, British, Americans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to get out of there, Paul. I will do whatever I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elite of the Tutsi refugees, those with contacts or f are gathered in the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There will be no rescue, no intervention force. We can only save ourselves. Call any foreigner you know, tell them what will happen to us. Say goodbye but when you say goodbye, say it as though you're reaching through and shaking their hand. Let them know if they let go of that hand, you will die. (silence) We must shame them into sending help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others look stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on the phones while we still can. At least we can say they heard our cries. Zozo come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul looks around the lobby. It resembles a refugee cente five star hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to a computer, calls up the register, then hits erases the register.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up the phone, calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send two of the housekeeping carpenters to the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul strides across the lobby, calls to Zozo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone gather together now. Zozo get them all together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They herd together quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one can remain in this lobby any longer. I have rooms available. Who can pay? The rental is six hundred francs per day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About fifty percent of the hands go up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot pay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go with Zozo to the ballroom. We will find you bedding. This is a hotel. No one will be allowed to stay in the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The carpenters arrive beside Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I want you to go around and take all the numbers off the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What shall we put in their place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I want no numbers on the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul going door to door, knocking. The rooms are all pack refugees. A door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good day. Here is your bill for the last week. If you cannot pay, or think you will not be able to pay, go to the ballroom. Zozo will take care of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul knocks on a door. The Tutsi politician Xavier opens that it is Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful two-bedroom suite. Xavier lives in comfort co other refugees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid you will have to move room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move? Where to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to put you on the third floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The third floor are low class rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes they are. However if the army return they will expect important people such as yourself to be in these grand rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his wife) Pack the bags, we have to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also, this is your bill for the last week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul leaves, Xavier looks shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and influential refugees, Odette, Benedict (with a b his missing ear), Xavier and others call, plead, write an all around the world. We see this NIGHT and DAY; DAY and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hen Odette on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that's right. I helped set up the treatment center in Nairobi. I'm in the Mille Collines Hotel right now with my husband, Peter, and my two boys. If you do not help us we will be murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zozo arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, General Bizimungu is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pool patio is deserted except for General Bizimungu a soldiers who lounge at a table. Gregoire and his girlfrie reclining deck chairs like movie stars. Paul and a waiter of drinks join the General.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am glad you are well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul hands the scotch to Bizimungu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry it is not Glenmorangie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as it is scotch. (drinks) Your white friends have abandoned you, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The United Nations are still here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) The United Nations. Madmen are on the streets, Paul. But I will take care of you. (chugs his drink) Your cellar is well-stocked, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, General. I am glad you came by. I overheard something that I think you should know about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you overhear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A discussion between an American Embassy official and a UN Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did they say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The American assured the colonel that they would watch everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch everything? How? They are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul points surreptitiously to the sky. The General looks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satellites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satellites?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, they can photograph the epaulets on your shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what will they do with these satellites?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The American said intervention is too costly, better to get photographic evidence and snatch up the high command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The high command? Our high command?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Snatch them up and put on a war crimes trial. Lock them all away forever. No political risk, and big publicity.' That's what he said. (a beat) I thought I'd better tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The General looks again to the sky then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Americans! Who are they to put us on trial. Let us imagine Paul when their president Kennedy was shot, they said it was a black man. Then their politicians, their radio stations gave orders `we must wipe out these black people before they wipe out us.' What do you think would have happened? No different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed, general. Excuse me momentarily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul fills Bizimungu's briefcase with scotch, hands two s beer to Zozo. Paul notes his once packed storeroom, now c dwindled in stock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where has all our beer gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, Gregoire has been taking beers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many beers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul arrives back at the pool, hands Bizimungu his briefc gives the beer to the soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am worried about thieves and criminals coming into the hotel. Perhaps you could arrange for some police to guard us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police are very busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand General, but when I last talked to the president of Sabena he promised me that anyone who helped protect Belgian property would be rewarded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bizimungu understands this is a financial proposition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Well rewarded" Those were his words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I were to spare a few policemen, where would I station them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front gate would be best, General. They could check all guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will see what I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I admire you, General. How do you keep command of your men amidst such madness?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am strong, Paul, like a lion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I were like you. Look at my staff, they won't work, they listen to no one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul nods over toward Gregoire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is staff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he General gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregoire, who is lying face down on the deck chair, doesn approach. The General pulls the deck chair from underneat throws it into the pool. As Gregoire tries to scramble to General propels him forward with a massive kick up the as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get to work, you slug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregoire races from the pool, followed by his girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The General clicks his fingers and his soldiers follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure, Paul, your guests are generous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict greets Paul in the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, we would like to speak to you in your office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We, who is we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A delegation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul walks in and discovers the office packed with the el refugees including Xavier, Odette and Jean Baptiste. Paul there's an air of tension in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A brief silence, then a Tutsi bank manager speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no right to charge us rent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is no longer a hotel, it is a prison and you are profiteering from our misery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another accuser speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it is. He charges for food, for everything. Where is all this money going? We hear he has a deal with Bizimungu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is said that you work for the murderer George Rutagunda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murmurs of agreement. Paul has heard enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I confess. ( a beat) It's true I have a deal with General Bizimungu. He was just here. I worked out another money making scheme for him. New arrivals will be taxed at the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what my deal is with Bizimungu. I pay him and he keeps you alive. Anyone want to take their money back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL pulls money from his pocket, hands it around, offers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, here take it. And you don't have to pay your bill. I will move you into the ballroom or out into the gardens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks among them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, yes, I work with George Rutagunda. I buy rice and beans, beer and soap. I will have to visit his warehouse soon because we are running out of food. Who wants to come with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul holds the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone who wants to come with me stay behind. If not, please leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hurry out, duly chastised. But Odette and her husban Baptiste remain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) You are most certainly not coming with me. You will get me killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't go to that place, they know what you are doing here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George will not hurt me, I am too profitable to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he is not there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul hasn't got an answer for that one. He leads them out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger is asleep, on a couch in the living room, several k the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TO THE BED: Where Tatiana suppresses bursts of laughter a the Gregoire story in whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as the General left he came running back. (mimics Gregoire) Help me, sir, I have been possessed by a witch. (Paul's own voice now) A witch you say? (mimics) Yes, yes, I did not know I was in that room. The president's room, why would I be in the president's room? (own voice) Indeed, the General asked me the same. (mimics) Asked you what? (own voice) Does Gregoire think he is president now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL mimics Gregoire's whimpers of fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Stop, stop, we will waken the children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul lifts the bottle of fine bordeaux, pours more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lynch Bages, 84. Perfect with lamb, or fine rare beef.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where is the lamb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe Gregoire and the witch ate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both chuckle, then Paul remembers, a cloud of anxiet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're running out of beer and other supplies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The foreigners abandon us and you do inventory. You are so conscientious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him again, tries to cheer him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go out to get food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go out! Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Rutagunda's place. It is close by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to, Tatiana, we are only as valuable as the service we provide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cannot go alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going alone. I'll take Gregoire with me. He's a good Hutu, and he wants to impress me now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lobby is deserted except for Gregoire now neatly dres

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: G           PAUL regoire it is good to see you back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, except my humblest apologies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I have a job this morning. I must go to visit my good friend George Rutagunda. You know George?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregoire nods, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fetch the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thick mist blankets the grounds as Paul and Gregoire em

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fearful) Where are we going, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For supplies, you drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fog is too heavy, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just drive, Gregoire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass the gate, the policemen are asleep in the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van passes along the deserted main road, past a wreck broken glass, the fog swirls around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Gregoire hits the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of them, a makeshift barricade, long poles stret two oil drums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wait for someone to appear from the fog: No one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should go back, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul wants to agree, but can't. He opens his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul gets out, tentative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. He moves to the barrier, lifts the pole, places ground, hurries back to the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive past the barricade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van weaves through the fog-enshrouded streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hey slow to check road signs in the fog - on one a woman' shredded and soaked in blood, is draped like a banner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fog still hangs like a cloud. As they pull up, a grou Militia emerge from Toyota trucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are to meet Mr. Rutagunda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The commander is not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He will be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me your ID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Gregoire hand over their ID cards. The Militia m them, then pockets the cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our cards, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What cards?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have our cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But I make cards. Would you like me to make you two cards?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thousand francs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then from out of the fog, three Toyota trucks roar up. Ge Rutagunda, heavily armed, in cut-off shorts and an open s barrel chest laden with bandoliers, jumps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he Militia man pulls out the ID cards, hands them back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: apologetic) joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rutagunda strides over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul. My old friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul climbs out, greets George, as a Militia man swings o of the warehouse. They walk in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warehouse is filled with looted televisions, artwork, points to the stacks of beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is double the price now, you do understand that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need rice, beans, beer, and your best whiskey.    G

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beer yes, but no whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no whiskey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No whiskey, no spirits. Your rich cockroaches at the hotel, they will have to do without their scotch. Anyway, I have bled that cow enough Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul counts out the Rwandan francs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean George?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their money is no good to them. Soon all the Ineysi will be dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) )                                          You cannot kill them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? We are half way there already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's stomach heaves. He hides it, turns over the money, van with Gregoire. George comes to the passenger window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me give you a tip my friend, our generals in the army say 'do not go near the Mille Collines or they will send the Belgian soldiers back here'. But the generals are about to leave, and we will be in charge. It is time to butcher your cow for the meat. (a beat) You can help us Paul. You have some very important traitors at your hotel. The politician Xavier. The liar Benedict. If we were to get them, then maybe we could let one or two cockroaches get away. You understand, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul says nothing, but Gregoire has been listening very c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the river road back. It is clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fog has gotten thicker. They can barely see a yard ah

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure this is the river road?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van begins to bump erratically. Bump, bump, bump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. You've driven off the road. You'll put us in the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van jerks to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul clambers out, stumbles, falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And discovers he's looking at the face of a dead child, a girl, her hands clasped on her ears as though to block th own death - an African Munz's Scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul clambers to his feet, sees that the van is on a road dead bodies, men, women, children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he bumps were dead bodies, the van has driven over them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A breeze from the lake blows the fog clear for thirty fee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEALING: a carpet of bodies, hundreds of them sprawled road as far as Paul can see. Paul wanders stunned among m corpses, made more ghostly by wisps of fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Paul clambers shell-shocked back into the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back! Go back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregoire throws the van into reverse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hey bump back over the carpet of bodies, each shake and c horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van pulls up at the rear suppliers entrance. Paul hop to Gregoire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell no one what you saw, do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregoire, Zozo and the porters begin unloading the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul wanders to a bench set back in a manicured grove of him a crowd of Rwandan refugee children play in the swimm laughing, jumping, splashing like they were at a municipa Central Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL watches. Tears stream from his eyes, the stream grow flood, he buries his face in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then a voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Manager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul wipes his eyes, turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little boy stands behind him, holding out his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Manager, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Paul sees what is wrong. The boy Has a big thorn imb muscle of his arm. Paul studies it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a big one. (pinches the thorn) Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul pulls on the thorn, the kid doesn't flinch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul picks him up, carries him to the pool, throws him in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana feeds the children - rice and beans. Paul arrives

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, Papa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, you have no greeting for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger tries to speak, struggles to mouth the words but no out, as though he has forgotten. Tears form in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, do not worry, no tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hugs him, puts him back at his food, then takes Tatian leads her to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They slip out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Paul, why do we have to go to the roof?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright. This is the only place I can find some peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul slips out onto the roof. Tatiana follows. Artillery fire rumble in the distance. Flashes silhouette along the above Kigali.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads her to a blanket, a candle, two glasses and the wine. They sit. He opens the wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) I hear we must pay for everything. How much for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a very good man, Paul Rusesabagina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he kisses him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a confession. When we met...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Ruhengeri?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, when you worked as the nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had you transferred to Kigali.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bribed the Minister of Health to have you transferred to Kigali.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be closer. So that I could marry you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the bribe? (silence) What am I worth to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was substantial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What sort of car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does it matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Volkswagen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Volkswagen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he slaps him playfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope it was a new Volkswagen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him, they lie back on the roof, kiss passionat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul instructs the porters to clean around the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The UN armored car comes up the driveway. Colonel Oliver strides across the tarmac, he shakes Paul's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great news, Paul, we're going to get you out of here.

dialogues.speaker: I
dialogues.text: The sweetest words Paul has ever heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver is on the stage, all the refugee guests are crowde room he has a list in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The UN has been notified that the following families have received travel visas from the following countries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abukesu - Tanzania, Arumangu -Zambia, Bawroanga - Kenya,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Elation among the chosen families.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gituaranga - Zambi, Horangora - Belguim

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON - Fear on the faces of families who realize they this alphabetical list, anxiety among the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paramisambi - Zambia, Rusesabagina - Belgium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana kisses Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zamacanga - Ghana. A plane will land at the airport tomorrow and the named families will be flown to Kenya. Two UN trucks will be here at 7 a.m. The named families must be ready to leave then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: voice calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel, sir. Why not take us all to the airport? We can wait there to obtain visas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that. Our camp at the airport is overwhelmed already. We could not defend you there. You are better to stay here and work to get an exit visa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver jumps from the stage, pushes through the crowd. Paul's POV: Odette and Jean Baptiste are silently devasta through to the Colonel now surrounded by those who didn't list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel, Odette Camundu ... she must be on the list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver shakes his head no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, only those I called can get on the trucks. I do not want to have to pull people off, you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul nods yes. Tatiana arrives beside him, pulls him asid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not leave without the twins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get out of here Tatiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, please try one more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try but we have to leave, with or without them. I want you to promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reluctantly nods yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Garindi waits nervously in the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is dangerous to be here. The radio says this is a nest of cockroaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need one last favor. Go back and get the twins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emphatic) No, it is impossible. That side of town has been destroyed in the fighting. The children are dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is dead there. The dogs eat the bodies in the street. I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will give you my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The businessman turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a fine house. Here is a paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul spots an elegant woman carrying laundry toward the e runs to her.            P

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame Kawunda, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul leads her over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to witness this signature. (to the businessman) Madame Kawunda is the Minister for Agriculture. She is a very reliable witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul signs, then hands the pen to the puzzled woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please witness this deed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She signs. Paul pushes the deed into the man's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, now go and find them. They have no papers. No one knows they are Tutsi. They will be alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The businessman heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be back by 7:00a.m. tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven, remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mr. Garindi leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul skirts the little groups of poor families bivouacked The smoke of cooking fires has replaced the Tiki lanterns are a mini refugee camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul joins Tatiana, Odette and Jean Baptiste who sit at a pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Paul, we will make the next list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOZO arrives, with beers, serves them, is about to leave. him by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit with us Zozo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ma,am, I am too busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zozo you are family, join us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zozo is shocked by this breach of protocol but sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are my dearest friends. I promise you before God that I will not sleep until I have you out of here. All of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He embraces Jean Baptiste

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is good that you are going, Paul, because now we know we have one person who will save us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Odette hugs and kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We owe you our lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul takes Zozo in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are my family now, Zozo, my brother. I will get you out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us remember this night and tell the world that even in hell there are good people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A unbreakable bond of faith with each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lucky families are gathered: Tatiana and all her chil and his wife; Benedict; and others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of the unlucky ones peer around the door of the ball officer stands in their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back. Everyone back. Only those with letters of acceptance in the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The UN convoy waits outside.   Tatiana waits nervously as his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little longer, Paul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wait until 7:00. If he is not here with the twins he is not coming. We leave. That was your promise. Go help the children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul is in a horrible mood. The refugees in the ballroom the UN officer. Paul joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back, please. Stay back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zozo, tell those people to get back to the ballroom. They can not be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zozo scampers off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we waiting for? Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul herds the convoy people toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Gregoire watching from behind the front desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the doors we see the trucks being loaded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zozo returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, the others want to speak to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reluctant, Paul walks over to the ballroom dwellers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, sir we have letters, please take them for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul reaches out for the letters, takes them, reads the a President Nelson Mandela. Pope John Paul. President Clint

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you leave, we are certain to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a letter, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zozo hands Paul the letter. He studies the address. It re great man Muhammad Ali."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: thers crowd around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will get you all visas. I promise. I will get you out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's at a loss. He has to tear himself away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
