dialogues.text: fraid to look back, he heads for the convoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last of the evacuees clamber onto the UN trucks. The on board but Tatiana waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask them to wait a little longer. For the twins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on the truck, Tatiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He checks his watch, then takes her in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, our children are crying, please get on the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul helps Tatiana on board. He looks toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV: The unlucky refugees are now crowded at the windows, watching out from their prison at the lucky ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul whispers to Benedict as he boards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul clambers on beside him.   He reaches Tatiana as Bene beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Sit down now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot leave these people. I will wait for the twins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul backs off. Tatiana tries to follow. Benedict grabs h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go. Let me off this truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A commotion as she tries to get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go. Children get off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will follow on the next plane. Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck starts up. Paul runs beside it, shouts to Tatia

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. Keep the children safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then another voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa! Papa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy takes off down the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, Zozo and other refugees cluster by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOZO looks round,

dialogues.speaker: I
dialogues.text: Sees: Gregoire put a phone down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UN Colonel Oliver sits next to a UN PAKISTANI DRIVER. he convoy passes looters and small groups of Militia on t proceeds unheeded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is still littered with clothes, kids drawings, t junk accumulated over four weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul tries to arrange things, then collapses on the bed, doubt - Why did he do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the door bangs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss, sir, quick, please, come quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door springs open, Paul confronts Zozo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless) Sir, the radio, you must hear, it is on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Zozo burst into the kitchen. The cooks and other clustered, listening to the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Block the roads to the airport! The cockroaches from the Mille Collines are escaping! Xavier. The liar Benedict, the traitor Rusesabagina's cockroaches. Stop them now at Rue Don Bosco. Thirty thousand francs for the head of Xavier!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear lord, how did they know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw Gregoire make a call, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the trucks go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul bursts out of the kitchen - enraged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregoire is at the front desk. Sees Paul - understands in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregoire takes off, running for his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul chases after him, through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregoire disappears into the thicket of trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregoire, younger, faster, climbs the high wire fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Paul reaches the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sees Gregoire escape into the bushes on the other side of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul gives up, turns back toward the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the UN jeep turns a bend, Colonel Oliver SEES crowds o swarming from beside houses, from gardens. They pull burn furniture, junk onto the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The UN truck suddenly lurches, then slows.    The refugee Collines grow alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul is on the fax phone, begging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, General, I will give you money, whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you had no whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I have money. They're driving into an ambush, it's on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swarms of crazed Militia fill the road. Gun fire breaks o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Oliver steps from the jeep, waving his pistol in

dialogues.speaker: M
dialogues.text: ilitia men swarm around him, push past to the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACHETE SLASHES through the canvas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hildren scream, HANDS GRAB at people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict is hauled off the truck. Beaten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana protects her kids in a corner, kicking at the han for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE STREET: Xavier falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screams, shouts, MORE SHOTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver fights his way through to Xavier. Oliver points his pistol. The crowd backs off slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Xavier gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG - more gun fire. IMMACULATA falls, wounded in the fo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More are dragged from the trucks. Machetes flash in the s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then HORNS, GUNFIRE - RWANDAN SOLDIERS drive through the jeeps. The crowd scatters, then re-forms as Rwandan soldi between the Militia and the refugees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they do, another Militia gunman steps out, fires wildl refugees, but wounds A RWANDAN SOLDIER in the stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly fights erupt between the Militia and the soldier

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul paces up and down, he can hear gunfire in the distan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul jumps in the van, guns the engine, drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul's van speeds toward the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a UN JEEP, its tires shot out, sparks cascading from w screams up to the guard house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul slams on the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jeep is followed by the two trucks, their canvas slas in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul throws the van into reverse and clears the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy pulls up in front of the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloody and battered, the terrified refugees fall from the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Odette run among the casualties. Then he sees th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana, clothes torn, scratches on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids screaming in terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL runs to them, grabs, kisses, weeps louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Battered refugees everywhere, other hotel residents looki equally terrified because: They know they are doomed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul sees Roger, trembling, tears soak his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa! Papa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs Roger up. Tatiana struggles to Paul, embraces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God you are safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana breaks from the embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he bring the twins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul shakes his head no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul sits alone on his secluded bench in the garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cloud of despair shrouds him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he watches several women dip cooking pots into the poo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: e hurries toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P              There is no water from the pipes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL heads for the front doors. He's intercepted by the t policemen stationed at the gate by Bizimungu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: here is our beer? You promised us beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you explain to the good General that I have temporarily run out of stock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said to ask Mitterand and the French to send you more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will get it in due time. Now, please, get back to the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul enters, sees Zozo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this about no water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true, sir, the water has been turned            off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul enters. Odette, Benedict watch CNN on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL shakes his head in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can still get CNN here in hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A state department woman gives a press conference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Americans are talking about us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the reports we have received from Rwanda it appears that acts of genocide have been committed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, how many acts of genocide does it take to declare this a genocide?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, ahh, there is, ahh we have terminology, that has been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't answered the question. How many acts of genocide before your government will declare this a genocide?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not prepared to, nor am I able.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in the room is dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Benedict begins laughing, a maniacal laugh, then he chest, and hoots like a chimpanzee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got it. I have the answer. Watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all stare as he begins beating his chest, and hoppin an ape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must become mountain gorillas. Then they can put us on the endangered species list. Come on, try it. They think we're halfway there already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict hops up onto a desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door flies open. It's General Bizimungu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He surveys the room, then points at Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bizimungu looks terrible, an alcoholic suffering D.T.s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are my supplies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, General. The cellar is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have cockroaches dancing on tables and you tell me the cellar is empty? Did they drink my whiskey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We have no way of finding other stock but I have money for you from the guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul pulls a bundle of notes, hands them to the General.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rwandan francs! They are only good now for wiping your ass. There is nothing more I can do for you people. No police. No protection. You're on your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The General storms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul walks through the lobby. He carries an ash tray to a the futile task of a dedicated hotel manager on auto-pilo UN jeep pull up outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul meets the UN soldiers, (They are the four Ghanians w gate). They look frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The policemen have gone. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ran out of whiskey. Please go down and guard us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then ROAR of an engine and the CRASH of splintering wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a battered Toyota pickup appears, it races up the driv truck drags the wooden gatehouse on a rope behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crazed Militia pack the bed of the pickup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG, BANG, BANG. A Militia man fires a pistol into the a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tutsi refugees camped on the lawn flee in panic as th truck speeds around the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Militia taunt and yell at the Tutsi refugees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck does a screeching turn and heads back down the leaving a trail of splintered wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down there and stop them, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the Ghanians are really frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down and stop them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know we cannot shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean you cannot shoot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are peacekeepers, it is not in our mandate to shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then go and pretend you are soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Tatiana pass the clusters of families around the fires. They pass the pool, now just a third full. He sits bench in the grove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are almost out of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are almost out of everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a good life, you and I. I want to make our peace. To thank God for the time we had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her, total love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to have a plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What sort of plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our children cannot see us die first. If the Militia comes, you must hurry up to the roof. I will meet you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please do not talk like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to. If I do not come, you must take them all by the hands and jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts her hands to her ears. He pulls them down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The machete is no way to die. Promise me you will do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cries harder and squeezes his hand in fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: uddenly, A BANG, from behind them and then above their he of fire - an RPG rocket - zigzags toward the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUGE EXPLOSION on the wall, one-story beneath the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul throws Tatiana to the ground, covers her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moke and concrete dust fall around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, Zozo stand amongst the debris: a gaping hole in a w is covered in burned note papers, menus brochures for Sab hotels, the Mille Collines and the Diplomat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Odette appears carrying her medical bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was anyone hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It was only a storeroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Oliver arrives in his armored truck. Paul, Odette others gather around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fired a rocket at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   Where are the Rwandan police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ran out of bribes. Bizimungu took them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That explains it. I'm sorry to tell you this but we've heard rumors the Militia are getting ready to storm the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you protect us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, I don't have the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have no one...We will be killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rebels have fought their way into the city. They have many Hutu prisoners. They're willing to exchange them for you all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will the Hutu army agree?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so. They are in disarray now. The rebels are winning, and the Hutu high command are anxious to get some of their men back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would we escape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By convoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time the Militia will kill us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will surely kill us here. It's over here. We have to take the chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we'll be chopped on the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be chopped here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd disperses. Colonel Oliver takes Paul aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man came to my headquarters, asked that I give you this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel   Oliver hands a letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, I need you to buy me a day or two. I don't have the fuel for this convoy. I will have to scrounge it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. I have nothing left to bribe with. Can your men at the gate hold out for another day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Paul, they're afraid. They've demanded to be moved back to headquarters now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me their uniforms. I will put people at the gate, in disguise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could, Paul. Try to hold out. One more day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Oliver leaves. Their is nothing more Paul can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana is beside him. He opens the envelope, finds his m deed and a note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's from Garandi. (reads) I am sorry. There is no hope for the twins. The old lady's house has been destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul sleeps fitfully. It is almost dawn, then he sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Diplomat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana wakens, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go to the Diplomat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul is on the one working phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General, sir. I am glad to find you. I have found you some supplies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whiskey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The finest, and cognac, champagne. Come and I will get them for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring back your policemen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But the line is already dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bizimungu's jeeps arrives at the hotel. Paul greets him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must go to the Diplomat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your police are at the gate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the Diplomat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul clambers in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jeep turns away from the Mille Collines front gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They travel at high speed along the road. Then the driver horn, because...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul sees: A large crowd of Militia marching along the ro hotel, waving machetes and sticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can go where they want. They are in charge now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, General?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have decided to move the government to Gitarama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul arrives into the lobby of the Diplomat. Looters have place bare. The convoy pulls up. General Bizimungu stands pistol out. The looters see him and disperse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggots!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul enters the manager's office, followed by the General stripped clean, except for the safe, which is pock-marked strikes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOSE ON: Paul: he sees a big problem. The dial is damaged

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do your work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul goes to the safe and turns the dials, tries the hand It is incredibly hot, and Paul is soaked with nervous per takes off his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might be damaged, General.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bizimungu's look says: it better not be for your sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul starts again, turns the dials more carefully, tries safe door. CLICK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls it open, sees six bottles of Glenfiddich, four b brandy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bizimungu is joyous as Paul hands him a bottle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bizimungu sits on a window ledge, takes a swig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. (offers) To celebrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL takes a swig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what the Scottish call it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ishca Baha - the water of life. I went on a tour once of the finest single malt distillery in the world. Have you ever been to Scotland?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful country, wonderful golf. I wonder - will I ever go back? What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope we all get to do many things. Can we go now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier arrives with a box. He whispers to Bizimungu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the soldier) Pack those carefully, put them in my jeep, and guard them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looses his cool) Please, General, call and put your policemen back at the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldier packs the bottles. Bizimungu pours into Paul'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am going to do you a great favor. (studies glass) I am going to take you with us to Gitarama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not want to go to Gitarama, General.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cannot go back to the hotel. The crazy men are going there now. Better to come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul is now terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Militia are at the hotel?! We must go back now, General, please, for my family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bizimungu, now tipsy, drinks more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are better here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate, forceful) Listen, you need me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bizimungu laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a marked man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Americans, and the UN they have you as a war criminal. You are on a list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am on a list! What list?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the Europeans left, their soldiers gathered lists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bizimungu grabs Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you do not help me, you will stay on that list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I committed no war crimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who will tell them? You need me to tell how you helped the hotel. The others who have gone, they blame you for all their misfortune. They say you led the massacres.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous now) I led no massacres.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they will believe you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will tell them the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defiant) I will do nothing unless you help me now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bizimungu reaches for his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do, shoot me? It will be a blessing. Go ahead shoot. I will pay you to shoot my family. You can do nothing to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bizimungu jumps up, grabs Paul, pulls him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will tell them I did nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Bizimungu rush out to the jeeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul almost overcome with anxiety. Bizimungu worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Militia swarm around the front of the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jeeps race through, scattering them. They screech to Several refugees sit, huddled and battered. Bizimungu jum snatches an A.K. from a soldier, fires in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back! (to his soldiers) Get them out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL does not wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul races into the hotel, past frightened refugees who f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Paul sees a face he recognizes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Gregoire with the Militia! Paul ducks into the stair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaps the stairs four at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes it to the third floor, pushing past frightened r race down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs straight into a bunch of young Militia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rusesabagina. Show us Rusesabagina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shove Paul along the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show us the manager. He wears a suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have him in the lobby, go quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The killers race off.    Paul gets to his feet and runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul bursts in.    The place is a mess. And it's empty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, please Lord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He careens out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And sees Gregoire coming with a group of Militia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him. That's Rusesabagina!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They charge toward Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then a roar of gunfire. The ceiling and walls around Greg General Bizimungu's men run up with weapons drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out, or I'll shoot you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul rushes to the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More gunfire echoes (soldiers clearing the Militia).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT THE STAIRS - Paul races upward, falls, pushes past oth to get down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT THE ROOF - now, there are clumps of refugees who have including Xavier who huddles in a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana! Oh God. Have you seen Tatiana?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul runs to the edge of the roof, looks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEES: bodies -   women, and children, still, on the groun row of hedge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams in agony)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bodies move, look up, it's not them. It's refugees hi delirious with fear, runs along the parapet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BELOW he sees soldiers herding the Militia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs back to the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE THE STAIRCASE: He jumps four stairs at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE THE CORRIDOR: Soldiers are chasing off the Militia

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TO HIS ROOM: Paul staggers in, crazed with fear. He looks bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTO THE BATHROOM - empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's about to run out again, sees the connecting door to hotel room is slightly open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTO THE ADJOINING ROOM: It's empty, then A WHIMPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM THE BATHROOM, he moves in, cautious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE BATHROOM: Nothing. He moves over, pulls back the s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reveals: A cluster of women and children, the older ones over the mouths of the younger ones. And there at the bac his kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright, they're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears, hugs, women tremble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grey of dawn, before the sunrise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Oliver in his jeep leads a convoy of UN trucks pa house and Bizimungu's police and up the drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked in front of the hotel. Tutsi refugees file up and board by UN soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul helps Tatiana and the children onto a truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ARGUMENT breaks out towards the back of the convoy. Pa toward Xavier and Benedict who argue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They should go one truck at a time. When the first truck gets through to the airport, then the others will follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't wait. We all go together or not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul takes matters into his own hands. He locks the doors There is no going back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is time to leave. The Mille Collines is closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul climbs onto the truck. The others follow, some reluc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Oliver gives the signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trucks take off down the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul now at the front of the truck

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WATCHES out through a slice in the canvas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEES, the convoy pull out of the Mille Collines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They travel along the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn a corner, and the truck slows ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAUL SEES: a great mass of Hutus fill the road:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Militia, kids, soldiers discarding uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No longer a mob, but a crush of Hutu refugees now fleeing fleeing the advancing of the rebel army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd of Militia men wave their arms, shout at the truc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't stop. Push through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver reluctantly speeds up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A break in the mass of Hutu refugees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then GUN FIRE ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Children begin crying, it becomes infectious, spreading t children, some of the women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then ahead, a gang of Militia men break from the bushes b road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're running fast toward the truck, some carry rifles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's more gunfire behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Militia are almost upon them now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Oliver has his pistol drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Militia are at the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they run STRAIGHT PAST!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a platoon of Tutsi rebel soldiers (in bush camouflage blue headbands) burst from the brush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pursuing, careful, professional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the rebels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crying stops. Silent disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've made it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheering breaks out. Children frightened again by the sud break into cries of joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rebel soldier waves his AK 47 in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trucks crawl into the chaos of the stadium, a mass of wounded, lost children, abandoned old people, hundreds cr together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, Tatiana, and the others clamber off the trucks. The outpouring of relief. Then Tatiana spots someone among th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rushes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen my sister Fedens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heads shak `no'. Tatiana moves on, more frantic, pushing crowds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two little girls, twins, an old woman had them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More `nos'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now she's desperate, pushing, tripping through the crowds her we see others doing the same, then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama, mama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches her, pulls at her dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama, wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, mama, look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tatiana turns .... and sees Paul carrying the twins in hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She squeals with joy, runs to him, snatches one from his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my babies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anais, it is so good to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Carine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Tatsi's arms) And I'm Anais!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their laughter mix with tears of joy among the crushing m survivors.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO OF
dialogues.text: George Rutagunda was convicted of crimes against humanity serving a life sentence in a Tanzanian jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Augustin Bizimungu escaped with the Hutu Militia to the C August, 2002 he was captured in Angola. A UN war crimes t charged him with crimes against humanity.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO OF
dialogues.text: Fedens' bodies where never found. Paul adopted their twin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHOTO OF: PAUL (the lead actor) RUSESABAGINA: saved the lives of all one thousand two hun refugees who took shelter at the Mille Collines Hotel.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO TURNS TO PHOTO OF REAL PAUL AND HIS FAMILY.
dialogues.text: Tatiana, the twins, and all their family now live in Belg Paul owns and operates two taxi cabs.
